messages.content: ComfyUI_Textarea_Loaders is a custom node that allows the input for some loaders to be text instead of a file selector. This is particularly useful in scenarios where dealing with numerous loaders and prompt editing can be time-consuming.
What are the benefits of using ComfyUI_Textarea_Loaders?
The benefits include reducing the time spent on selecting loading loras and editing the prompt, as the input can be entered directly into a text area.

Users can install it from the ComfyUI repository by downloading the codes, extracting the zip, and cloning the repository. It can also be used in conjunction with a chrome extension, <https://github.com/Sieyalixnet/ComfyUI-Prompt-Formatter-Extension>, to dynamically edit the input of the loader.
What are the available nodes listed in ComfyUI_Textarea_Loaders?

The nodes listed are TextFormatter/BasicNodes/LoRALoader_Text, TextFormatter/BasicNodes/CheckPointLoader_Text, TextFormatter/BasicNodes/EmptyLatentImage_Text, and TextFormatter/BasicNodes/LoadImage_Text.
What extra information is provided for the node EmptyLatentImage_Text?
The EmptyLatentImage_Text node allows the user to enter the batch size data in a text area.
What is the warning for the LoadImage_Text node?
The LoadImage_Text node advises users that `mask` is not valid and they should use an alternative method to load the mask.
